lines.text: Damn it, Tommy! We don't need umbilical cords! This is TV!
Rent-A-Spoons!
Cole, do me a favor.
What's up?
Remind me to give you an ass-whoopin' later.

[pulls out pen & pad]
What time is good for you?
44 though.
44, I'ma be waitin' on that ass-whoopin'.
[repeated line]
Cole... you stupid.
I told you, you could super-size it!
I told you!... I'm a lady, and you don't disrespect no lady! You better watch your back!
Sheneneh, I can't buy nothin' with $5!
You can buy a one-way ticket to get the hell outta' my face!
I'll see you in Hell, Martin!
Yeah, you'll be the only one down there still living with your mother!
Pam, your hair is so nappy Wilson couldn't pick it!
Stanks a lot, Pam.
My mama always told me, if she can't use your comb, don't bring her home!
Tommy, you dated a white girl in college!
Oh, no, she wasn't white! She was French!

Yeah. I had a dream one time. I was climbin' this fire escape, and I couldn't make it to the top. So I climbed through the window of this fly ass crib!. With a big see-thru 'fridgerater. It was full of sammiches! But... , but... I couldn't open the door Martin! So I just stood there and cried man. Oh yeah! Bro'man cried.
Martin, don't fight this! Don't you want me?
No, slut, I want you!

[repeated line; to Tommy]
You ain't GOT no job, man!
[repeated line]
I'm Bruh-Man.
[holds up four fingers]
From the fifth flo'
Pam, do you prefer to be called "Ms. or Mr."?
Do you prefer "Jack" or "Ass"?
Brother Man, whatcha doin' here, man?
Nothin'
[pause]
just chillin'.
Cole, I got four words to say to you - Un, em, ploy, ment!
That's because you don't have an IQ of 31 like me.
Don't you mean 13?
Tommy, it's all good. If you like her, then we like her. It don't matter what color she is. I don't care if she's black, white, green, or whatever.

[laughing]
Martin, c'mon now! You know you'd be trippin' if Tommy was dating a green girl.
[Two midgets want Tommy to step outside with them in regards to some beef]

[ready to rumble]
Tommy, you alright? Want me to come with you?
Martin, c'mon now! I can handle this on my own. I mean, what they gonna do? Untie my shoes?
[laughs hysterically]
Kid, can you kiss me like you did that light-skinned girl in House Party?
[repeated line]

[singing]
Uh-uh! Uh-uh-uh! I say Jerome's in da house! I say Jerome's in da hou-oo-ah-oo - In da house!
[Martin has insulted Pam during a toast to her marriage]
Martin, stop it!
Nah, nah, it's ok Gina. I mean, Martin did climb all the way down from that wedding cake to make this toast.

[about Cole's lousy new apartment]
Cole, c'mon now! This place is so small, that you gotta go outside to change your mind!

[shouting]
Is that your wife, or is your dog walking backwards?
You know I'm sensitive about my job, you didn't have to go there!
You know I'm sensative about my buck shots, you didn't have to go there!
There's a difference, a good job is hard to come by, but they got Dark & Lovely on damn near every corner you pass!
[repeated line]
Get to steppin'! Step!
Umm girl, you got fire and spice.
Oh you said two keywords. You said I have fire and spice. So stay away fo' I burn yo ass up!
Cole! no you are NOT cuttin' yo' crusty-ass toenails up in here!
This is great. This is really, really, great. I fly all the way here with Harold Muppet and the Blue Notes, and I still can't get out of this marriage.
Sheneneh, you say you're a Christian woman... yet you sit here and you lie to these people. Now you better tell 'em the truth and tell them now!
Every move you make, every breath
[sniffs]
you take... I'll be watching you!
Struck by lightning, stay away from me!
The Lord know I just be playin' around!
Bro'man! it's 3 in the morning! What are you doin' up in here?
[repeated line]
WAZZUP!
Pam, is that your breath smellin' like boiled bologna?
No, that's yo' feet eatin' through those shoes again.
[Gary Coleman guest stars as "Maddog"]
Let me tell you, I'm gonna start making money the right way. I'm a florist now.
What'chu talkin' 'bout, Maddog?
Oh don't play dumb with me Gina! You know damn well what this is about! You got too much head to be stupid! You didn't even invite me to the wedding! I'm still pissed about that... Thin Thighs!
Cole, do me a favor. Remind me to give you an ass-whoopin' tomorrow.

[pulls out pen & pad]
What time is good for you?
[the gang thinks Tommy is rushing into marriage]
This is ridiculous! How's Tommy gonna marry someone he just met?
At a church, Gina. Duuuh!
Oh my goodness! Oh my goodness!
Where are they going to get married?
At a church, Gina. Duh!
Cole, the next time you think about getting another place, I don't wanna hear about it. Don't even call me!
Cole.
Yes?
I want you to testify for me.
[Cole and Shanise carry on as if they were in church]
I'm talkin' 'bout testifyin' in court, Cole!
Oh, my goodness! Somebody get me the witness protection program!
Yo' applehead stole my boy!
If I was still living that foul life, I'll get Franklins, but I'm not!
(singing) Laquita Lumpkins an' her homegirl Sheneneh in da hizz-ouse! Hey!
I keep having these nightmares. You ever have them?
Martin was the one who said Cole was a virgin until he was 23!
He said the stew was so bad, the homeless give it back!
I love the stew, baby! It looked like Alpo, but I loved it!
If you don't get yo' Smokey-the-Bear, corny-joke tellin' behind out there, *you* are goin' to need a search party! That's the oath!
I heard that, Ashford and Shrimpson!
[leaving a message]
Mom, I don't like it here. I wanna come home and my place is wack! See you later. Oh, and by the way, this is your son, Cole.
When you're with Pam, read the signs. When you feed bears, they follow ya home!
There's nothing wrong with my head, Martin! There's nothing wrong with my head!
[At haunted house, a howling sound is made from the background]
That's just Pam, letting us know she's alright.
See you later, Pam... my little chocolate ho-ho.

[offended]
What did you call me?
He meant "ring ding"... like the cupcake.
[leaving message on answering machine]
Mom, I wanna come back. I'm lonely and my place is wack. Oh, and if you get this message, it's me, Cole.
